definition: imperial examinations (in former times)
branch of study/administrative section/division/field/branch/stage directions/family (taxonomy)/rules/laws/to mete out (punishment)/to levy (taxes etc)/to fine sb/CL:個|个[ge4]
to lift/to hold up/to cite/to enumerate/to act/to raise/to choose/to elect/act/move/deed
variant of 舉|举[ju3]
to beat/to hit/variant of 考[kao3]/to inspect/to test/to take an exam
to check/to verify/to test/to examine/to take an exam/to take an entrance exam for/deceased father
to test/to try/experiment/examination/test

sentences.english: You have earned enough merit to pass the imperial examinations.
sentences.chinese: 你们的福报足以使你们通过科举考试。

sentences.english: Mingfa is one of the subjects of imperial examinations in Tang Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 明法是唐代科举考试的科目之一。

sentences.english: The westward spread into Europe and America of the imperial examination system marked a great contribution of China to world civilization.
sentences.chinese: 科举考试西传欧美是中国对世界文明进程的一大贡献。

sentences.english: The Eight-part essay was one of the special styles for the Imperial Examination from Ming to Qing Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 八股文是明清科举考试最基本也是最重要的一种文体。

sentences.english: In old China, this was where the academics from Yunnan province took their entrance exams for the imperial court.
sentences.chinese: 在旧中国，这里是云南参加朝廷的科举考试的学院。

sentences.english: Poem and Fu is an important part of Imperial examination from Tang to Early Northern Song Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 诗赋是唐代至宋初科举考试中的重要内容。

sentences.english: The Imperial Examinations is a means for the ruler to gather talents.
sentences.chinese: 而科举考试是统治者网罗人才的手段。

sentences.english: Imperial examination aimed to avoid the drawback of hereditary system.
sentences.chinese: 科举考试是为了矫正世卿世禄制的社会弊端而产生。

sentences.english: Talented he, will in the imperial examinations in gun fired?
sentences.chinese: 才华盖世的他，会在科举考试中一炮打响吗？

sentences.english: However, the examinations were extremely difficult.
LuFu is one of the important literary styles in Keju Examination.
sentences.chinese: 律赋是科举考试的一种重要也是最具有文学性的文体。

sentences.english: This poem was composed by Bai Juyi when he attended the imperial examination.
sentences.chinese: 这首诗是诗人白居易参加科举考试时的习作。

definition: imperial examination
the triennial provincial imperial exam during the Ming and Qing
court examination, the top grade imperial exam
imperial examination system
successful military candidate in the imperial provincial examination
to pass an exam
successful candidate in the highest imperial civil service examination/palace graduate
the last of the three entry-level exams in the imperial examination system of Ming and Qing dynasties
eight-part essay one had to master to pass the imperial exams in Ming and Qing dynasties
graduate/successful candidate in the imperial provincial examination
to take an exam
(old) candidate who has successfully passed the first grades of the examination system, but not yet the court examination (殿試|殿试[dian4 shi4])
court examination, the top grade imperial exam
metropolitan examination (imperial civil service examination)
title of the temporary position in the Hanlin Academy, conferred to meritorious candidates until the next examination
imperial exam involving writing essay on policy 策論|策论[ce4 lun4]
